availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Douglass Little (Presiding Judge McLean Co Ct.)

body.p: McLean County, Kentucky, blacksmith and judge. Kentucky native. Married Martha A. Little. Father of Lucius P. Little, Lycurgus L. Little, Finis H. Little, Jeptha F. Little, Alonzo P. LIttle, Ratliffe B. Little, M. Latta Little, John W. Little, Kate Little, and Georgia A. Little. Blacksmith in Calhoun, Kentucky, in 1860. Presiding Judge of the McLean County Court in 1863.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Kentucky, McLean County, Town of Calhoon, p. 1. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McLean County, Calhoun, p. 50. Find A Grave, "Douglass Little (1810-1877)," Memorial #37676990, https://findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=37676990 (accessed March 22, 2017).
